comments.subscription_id: Leave empty to use current logged-in subscription, or provide your Azure subscription GUID
comments.subscription_name: Leave empty to use current logged-in subscription, or provide subscription display name
comments.resource_group: Name of Azure resource group (will be created if it doesn't exist)
comments.location: Azure region (e.g., eastus, westus2, westeurope, northeurope)
comments.cluster_name: Name for your Arc-enabled Kubernetes cluster
comments.namespace_name: Name for Azure Device Registry namespace
comments.custom_location_name: Custom location name created during AIO installation (usually auto-generated like 'location-xxxxx'). Find with: az customlocation list -g <resource-group> -o table
comments.aio_instance_name: Azure IoT Operations instance name (usually '<cluster-name>-aio'). Find with: az iot ops list -g <resource-group> -o table
comments.custom_asset_endpoint: OPTIONAL: Name of existing asset endpoint to use as namespace resource (create this manually first)
comments.eventstream_topic_id: Get from Fabric portal: https://app.fabric.microsoft.com → Eventstream → Copy topic ID (format: es_aaaaaaaa-0000-1111-2222-bbbbbbbbbbbb)
comments.eventstream_alerts_topic_id: OPTIONAL: Separate Eventstream topic for critical alerts. Use same as eventstream_topic_id if not needed
comments.deploy_opc_ua_bridge: Set to true to automatically deploy OPC UA bridge for factory integration, set to false as I'm not using it
comments.skip_system_update: Set to true to skip apt update/upgrade for faster runs
comments.force_reinstall: Set to true to reinstall components even if they already exist

optional_tools.k9s: Terminal UI for Kubernetes cluster management. Enable for development/debugging.
optional_tools.mqtt-viewer: Installs mosquitto-clients (mosquitto_sub, mosquitto_pub). Enable for MQTT debugging and testing.
optional_tools.mqttui: NOTE: Currently unavailable in crates.io. Use mosquitto-clients instead for MQTT CLI tools.
optional_tools.ssh: Secure remote shell access with key-based authentication. Enable for remote management.

modules.edgemqttsim: Factory telemetry simulator. Enable for testing MQTT connectivity and data pipelines.
modules.hello-flask: Simple Flask web app. Enable for basic cluster validation.
modules.sputnik: Advanced application. Enable for comprehensive testing.
modules.wasm-quality-filter-python: WebAssembly edge filter. Enable for production edge processing.

usage_instructions.step1: Copy this file to 'linux_aio_config.json' in the same directory as linuxAIO.sh
usage_instructions.step2: Fill in your Azure subscription details (or leave empty to use current login)
usage_instructions.step3: Customize resource_group, location, cluster_name, and namespace_name
usage_instructions.step5: Run ./linuxAIO.sh - it will automatically load this configuration
